intro: Pseudocherleria pseudoimbricata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pseudocherleria, is a rare and lesser-known plant species belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, compound leaves that are often arranged in a whorled pattern along the stem. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of its family. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
